result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Lyle T. DeMoss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lyle T. DeMoss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lyle T. DeMoss was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.      ** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Pay DNA surcharge.  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No physical discipline or violent contact with Kari R.E. or K.P.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Lyle T. DeMoss, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State.  Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  
Count 1 - Deft. pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter enter a Hold Open Agreement for 12 months.  Motion to lift the no contact order is granted by the court, but there shall be no physical discipline or violent contact with Kari R.E. or K.P. 
Count 2 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.  
Count 3 - Dismissed by the State.  Appeal Rights given.  DPA Hearing on 10/1/15 at 10:30 AM.

Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription. No contact with K.P. (DOB 8-6-99) or residence. No violent contact with Kari R. E. No discussion of this case with Kari R. E. Not to live with Kari R.E.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 9-24-14 @ 2:30pm. Atty. Watson has filed bond motion and argues for modification of bond conditions. State does not take a position. Bond conditions amended as follows: no contact with Kari R. E. modified to no violent contact, no discussion of this case, and not to live with Kari R.E. Amount and all other conditions remain the same. Amended signature bond signed in court.
